Job Title: Director of Finance And Accounting

Location: United States

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Accounting/Auditing, Finance

Description:
Position: Director of Finance
About Us:East 57th Street Partners is a premier consultancy and executive search firm, dedicated to connecting our clients with the finest strategic and financial talent in the market. On behalf of our client, a forward-thinking company renowned for its innovative approach and market leadership, we are in search of an experienced Director of Finance. This leadership role is critical for steering the company’s financial strategy, optimizing financial performance, and supporting business growth.
Role Overview:The Director of Finance will serve as a key member of the executive team, responsible for leading the finance department and providing strategic financial guidance to ensure the company achieves its financial and operational goals. The ideal candidate will bring a strategic vision, combined with hands-on experience in financial management, to drive efficiency, profitability, and business expansion.
Key Responsibilities:Lead the financial planning and analysis (FP&A) efforts, including budgeting, forecasting, and supporting strategic business decisions with in-depth analysis.Oversee the accounting operations, ensuring accuracy in financial reporting and compliance with statutory law and financial regulations.Develop and implement financial policies and procedures to improve operational efficiency and provide guidance on financial planning and risk management.Manage the preparation of all financial reports, including income statements, balance sheets, reports to shareholders, and reports for government regulatory agencies.Direct capital structure strategies, investment analysis, and long-term financial planning.Collaborate with senior leadership to develop financial strategies that align with the company’s goals, and provide insightful advice to optimize financial performance.Lead, mentor, and develop the finance team, fostering a culture of high performance, continuous improvement, and professional growth.Qualifications:Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Accounting, Business Administration, or a related field. Master’s degree or professional certification (e.g., CPA, CMA) highly preferred.Minimum of 10 years’ experience in financial management roles, with at least 5 years in a senior leadership position, preferably within the same industry.Strong foundation in accounting principles and financial management, along with experience in financial modeling, analysis, and strategic planning.Demonstrated leadership ability, with a track record of developing high-performing teams and leading complex financial projects to successful completion.Exceptional analytical, organizational, and decision-making skills, with the ability to present complex financial information in a clear and concise manner.Proficient with financial management software, ERP systems, and Microsoft Office Suite.Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, capable of engaging effectively with staff at all levels of the organization and external partners.

Experience Level (if available): Executive
